item.title: Sin and Cosin
item.description:
Sin and cosin express the phase of a sin wave either in forward or backwards direction respectively.

As such, sin and cosin produce a number between -1 and 1 given an input angle.

They're used heavily across animations to produce repeating angular values:

 const pX = Math.cos(timestamp / timeCoefficient) * rad
 const pY = Math.sin(timestamp / timeCoefficient) * rad


Combinations therein can create cool affects, such as this one where the output "particle" follows in a radial fashion around a point on our circle.
